```{r}
# this gives us the total number of rows
earnings %>% count()

# numbers of men and women
earnings %>%
  count(gender)


# We can do arithmetic on these numbers
# calculate percentage
2353 / 4483 * 100


# counts for multiple subgroups
earnings %>%
  count(job, gender)


# making a plot
earnings %>%
  ggplot(aes(gender)) +
  stat_count()
```
